title: Understanding Analysis Types
text: In analytical chemistry, there are different types of analyses used to determine the composition of a sample. These include qualitative, quantitative, and characterization analyses.

title: Qualitative vs. Quantitative Analysis
text: Qualitative analysis is used to identify the presence of elements or compounds in a sample, while quantitative analysis measures the amount of these elements or compounds.

title: Characterization Analysis
text: Characterization analysis involves determining the physical and chemical properties of a sample, such as its structure or morphology.

title: Choosing the Right Analysis
text: Given that the chemist needs to determine the elements present in a mineral sample, which type of analysis should be used?
